alert.note: Alert for Arthur; Garden; Grant; Sheridan; Western Cherry (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 18 at 8:19PM CDT by NWS NorthPlatte
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern Arthur, western Cherry, western Grant, Garden and Sheridan Counties through 800 PM MDT... At 717 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Wolf Creek Housing to 17 miles south of Rushville to near Crescent Lake National Wildlife Refuge to Lisco. Movement was east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Gordon, Rushville, Ellsworth, Lisco, White Clay, Ashby, Antioch, Crescent Lake National Wildlife Refuge, Clinton, Big Hill, Dogtown Flats, Dipping Vat Meadow, Billys Lake, Lone Butte, Rock Hill, Miles Lake, Richardson Lake, Pine Ridge and Wickson Lake. This includes the following highways... Highway 20 between mile markers 81 and 134. Highway 250 between mile markers 1 and 48. Highway 2 between mile markers 96 and 144. Highway 61 between mile markers 187 and 190. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Arthur; Garden; Grant; Sheridan; Western Cherry
